meanings.definition: Relating to a proctor or their duties.
meanings.sent1: The proctorial exam rules were clear and fair.
meanings.sent2: The students followed the proctorial instructions during the test.
meanings.sent3: The proctorial presence in the exam room kept everyone honest.
meanings.sent4: Her proctorial gaze seemed to see through any attempt at cheating.
meanings.sent5: The proctorial authority maintained order and integrity in the examination hall.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to supervision or oversight.
meanings.sent1: The proctorial role ensured the safety of all participants.
meanings.sent2: The proctorial staff monitored the event closely.
meanings.sent3: The proctorial supervision made sure everything ran smoothly.
meanings.sent4: His proctorial eye caught every detail that needed attention.
meanings.sent5: The proctorial oversight guaranteed a well-organized process.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the role or responsibilities of a proctor.
meanings.sent1: Her proctorial duties included overseeing the examination process.
meanings.sent2: The proctorial tasks required attention to detail.
meanings.sent3: The proctorial responsibilities kept him busy throughout the day.
meanings.sent4: In his proctorial capacity, he ensured fairness for all.
meanings.sent5: The proctorial obligations demanded focus and impartiality.
